cluster_relations.rel_desc: Individuals benefit from participation in sports.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (e.g., an activity, experience, or set of lessons) provides positive effects, advantages, or life skills to the target entity or life domain.
remarks: Relation introduced to attach skill-learning benefits to individuals.
Relation introduced to attach skill-learning benefits to individuals.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Lessons from sports participation help individuals handle challenges in their personal lives.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (e.g., an activity, experience, or set of lessons) provides positive effects, advantages, or life skills to the target entity or life domain.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Life Skills and Lessons from Sports

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: helping individuals become better equipped to handle challenges
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: EffectType: improved ability to handle challenges

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Lessons from sports participation help individuals handle challenges in their professional lives.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (e.g., an activity, experience, or set of lessons) provides positive effects, advantages, or life skills to the target entity or life domain.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Life Skills and Lessons from Sports

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: helping individuals become better equipped to handle challenges
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: EffectType: improved ability to handle work-related challenges

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (e.g., an activity, experience, or set of lessons) provides positive effects, advantages, or improvements to the target entity or life domain.
args.justification: All three relations represent the same causal impact semantics where a sports-related activity or lesson confers positive effects on individuals or their life domains. The existing canonical name, rel_cls, and rel_cls_group are appropriate, but the description was slightly over-specific to 'life skills'; broadening it to generic positive effects and improvements better covers benefits to personal and professional lives while remaining consistent across instances.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (e.g., an activity, experience, or set of lessons) provides positive effects, advantages, or improvements to the target entity or life domain.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations represent the same causal impact semantics where a sports-related activity or lesson confers positive effects on individuals or their life domains. The existing canonical name, rel_cls, and rel_cls_group are appropriate, but the description was slightly over-specific to 'life skills'; broadening it to generic positive effects and improvements better covers benefits to personal and professional lives while remaining consistent across instances.
